ovdesc.p: OC.PARAMETER is a system level table to control the additional new aspects relating to OTC derivatives as per the Regulatory requirements in terms of Reporting, Clearing and Execution.
Parameters relating to T24 Bank are defined herein to meet the requirements of regulatory reporting and to control the workflows relating to Clearing and execution.

desc.p: It should be a valid company ID.
Legal Entity Identifier of the T24 bank. LEI will be used for precise, reliable, and unique identification of each party in a derivative trade.
Upto 40 alphanumeric characters can be allowed.
Regulator Name /ID, whose regulations, T24 bank has to comply with. For example, ESMA, CFTC, HKMA etc.,
This is a key field in OC.PARAMETER.
Should be a valid OC.REGULATOR ID.
Denotes the name space given by CFTC or any other regulator as applicable to T24 bank.
Part of Unique Transaction Identifier (UTI) where ever T24 bank is generating the UTI.
Denotes local country regulator ID as applicable to EU countries.
Should be a valid OC.REGULATOR ID.
This field indicates how the system should handle novation for cleared trades and will be used as and when Novation functionality is introduced.
Valid values are manual, auto and none.
This field indicates how the client collateral will be handled ,i.e. is it reported along with bank collateral or separately. Applicable only when Collateral management functionality is built/used.
Valid values are Yes and None.
This field indicates how the MTM value of collateral to be reported to Trade Repository. No workflows are envisaged based on the value in this field. Mainly for reporting requirement.
Valid values are per transaction and per portfolio.
This field indicates whether the bank has delegated the reporting to a 3rd Party.
Valid values are yes and None.
Denotes the regulatory classification of the T24 Bank.
Valid values are Swap dealer, Major Swap participant, Financial Counterparty, Other.
Denotes the default trade repository. Value given here will get defaulted at Trade level which can be overridden by the User.
Should be a valid OC.TRADE.REPOSITORY ID.
This field holds the UTI/USI generation routine/logic. The logic to generate the UTI/USI can be tailored to suit the Userâ€™s requirements.
Input should have a valid entry in PGM.FILE.
